TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageView extends Android.Views.View

Docs.summary: Displays an arbitrary image, such as an icon.

remarks.para: Displays an arbitrary image, such as an icon. The ImageView class can load images from various sources (such as resources or content providers), takes care of computing its measurement from the image so that it can be used in any layout manager, and provides various display options such as scaling and tinting.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Matrix ImageMatrix { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Return the view's optional matrix.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Return the view's optional matrix. This is applied to the view's drawable when it is drawn. If there is no matrix, this method will return an identity matrix. Do not change this matrix in place but make a copy. If you want a different matrix applied to the drawable, be sure to call setImageMatrix().

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Adds a transformation that is applied to the view's drawable when it is drawn. Allows custom scaling, translation, and perspective distortion.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList ImageTintList { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Applies a tint to the image drawable. Does not modify the current tint mode, which is by default.
Subsequent calls to will automatically mutate the drawable and apply the specified tint and tint mode using .

Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by } to the image drawable. The default mode is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAdjustViewBounds(bool adjustViewBounds) cil managed

Docs.param: Whether to adjust the bounds of this view to preserve the original aspect ratio of the drawable.
Docs.summary: Set this to true if you want the ImageView to adjust its bounds to preserve the aspect ratio of its drawable.

remarks.para: Set this to true if you want the ImageView to adjust its bounds to preserve the aspect ratio of its drawable.

Note: If the application targets API level 17 or lower, adjustViewBounds will allow the drawable to shrink the view bounds, but not grow to fill available measured space in all cases. This is for compatibility with legacy and behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetMaxHeight(int32 maxHeight) cil managed

Docs.summary: An optional argument to supply a maximum height for this view.

remarks.para: An optional argument to supply a maximum height for this view. Only valid if has been set to true. To set an image to be a maximum of 100 x 100 while preserving the original aspect ratio, do the following: 1) set adjustViewBounds to true 2) set maxWidth and maxHeight to 100 3) set the height and width layout params to WRAP_CONTENT.

Note that this view could be still smaller than 100 x 100 using this approach if the original image is small. To set an image to a fixed size, specify that size in the layout params and then use to determine how to fit the image within the bounds.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetMaxWidth(int32 maxWidth) cil managed

Docs.summary: An optional argument to supply a maximum width for this view.

remarks.para: An optional argument to supply a maximum width for this view. Only valid if has been set to true. To set an image to be a maximum of 100 x 100 while preserving the original aspect ratio, do the following: 1) set adjustViewBounds to true 2) set maxWidth and maxHeight to 100 3) set the height and width layout params to WRAP_CONTENT.

Note that this view could be still smaller than 100 x 100 using this approach if the original image is small. To set an image to a fixed size, specify that size in the layout params and then use to determine how to fit the image within the bounds.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetScaleType(class Android.Widget.ImageView/ScaleType scaleType) cil managed

Docs.summary: Controls how the image should be resized or moved to match the size of this ImageView.

remarks.para: Controls how the image should be resized or moved to match the size of this ImageView.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
